Reviews.Title: “Worst night of my life!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aliceinhaw
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed here 1 night and thought we were getting a good deal, but it was terrible and worst night of my life! Beware, it might be cheap, but not worth it! The pictures on their site are deceiving with camera tricks and only the best rooms they had or altered pictures because the rooms were definitely misrepresented! I understand it's a vintage, antique style hotel, but the room was dark, dingy, dirty, stinky, and just overall gross!!!!!! I was only there 1 night and I could barely even sleep. I felt like something was watching me and weird shadows that both and me my bf saw...not sure if this place is haunted or not, but after reading more about it, it was many different hotels and an apartment before the remodel! Creepy!!! The worst part was the next morning, after a night of terrible sleep, the toilet backed up and had feces in it-DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!! Staff was unhelpful or missing cause we only saw the front desk person and there is no elevator even now, when I've been reading that they've been "fixing it" apparently forever! My main advice is DON'T STAY HERE TO SAVE A FEW BUCKS!-cause the ghosts, bugs, or something horrible may get you!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect hospitality - it's non-existent”
Reviews.Author: LoneRangerEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks pretty good from the outside, doesn't it? It's a fine edifice, certainly, but that's about as good as it gets, apart from the many wonderful pictures of Hollywood Greats from the golden days on the walls of the upstairs corridors. The hotel itself is situated in what is virtually a 100% Hispanic part of LA, and it was difficult to shake off the feeling that, if you're Caucasian, you're only tolerated. The subway is a brisk 30 minute walk away and. from there, you're in Hollywood and the Sunset Strip in less than 10 minutes. The buses take for ever, though. It wasn't much to pay for a hotel room relatively close to Hollywood. However, the carpets are dirty, the rooms (well, mine anyway) shabby and sparsely furnished although, in fairness, the bedding was clean and turned down every day. There are no brochures or leaflets in either the foyer or the rooms to help you decide where best to visit, which should tell you everything you need to know about the general attitude towards guests which, going by my experience, is: you represent income, you're only passing through, and we are not remotely interested whether you come back or not. Fact: the staff were awful. Apart from one young man they were uniformly unfriendly, unsmiling and made not a single effort to make my week's stay a pleasant one. No-one could be bothered to make conversation once, not even to ask if I was enjoying my visit to LA. I'm staggered to read glowing reports on the hotel, and particularly its staff, from supposedly other 'correspondents'. Frankly, I strongly suspect they are posted by the hotel or others with a vested interest. I stayed a week because I had paid in advance. One or two nights will be tolerable - but don't expect hospitality - it's non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! Thought we were getting a good deal...”
Reviews.Author: Katie G
Reviews.Content: A friend and I (two 25 year old girls) thought this was a great deal considering we only really needed a safe place to sleep for two nights during our 3-day Los Angeles area adventure. We got to Hollywood in the afternoon of April 11th. We decided to check around the neighborhoods of the hotel before we checked in to see if there was anywhere close we could grab dinner and a few drinks. No where close by that seemed safe and sanitary. Therefore, we chose to stay in the hotel that night. On a side night, the parking area was safe and very accessible. The room seemed okay and did have a flat screen tv. When we took showers we realized the towels were dirty and stained so asked housekeeping for a fresh set. Our room had been on the side of the street. This meant we didn't sleep past 7am because traffic was so loud with constant big trucks and ambulances flying by. When we checked out the desk clerk didn't even go as far as saying "hello" to us or "thanks for staying here." We decided it was $57/night so whatever. We returned home and nine days later (which was two days before I wrote this review) I woke up with 18 bug bites on my body. I freaked out and googled any possible causes. I read online that it generally takes 9 days for bed bug bites to appear on your body. I then read the reviews of previous guests and read that they also had experienced bed bugs!! I freaked out and sanitized my whole apartment, including washing the clothes i took on my trip three times. I also had more bite marks appear yesterday, which was the 9th night from staying there the last night we did (April 12th). I have yet to actually find that any of the bed bugs had joined me on our travels back. Regardless, I have done everything possible (without calling an exterminator) to prevent these bugs from taking over my apartment). I will be sure to comment back in case I do. Moral of the story, BED BUGS possibilities are not worth the STRESS, ANXIETY, and UGLY BITE MARKS that you may receive from saving a couple bucks to stay at the "Historic" (aka old furniture infested with bed bugs) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the price!!”
Reviews.Author: PollyTiger
Reviews.Content: Ok it's cheap accomodaion and not in walking distance but for my partner and I it was brilliant. We hired a car and there was easy parking and easy driving distance. Our room was basic- television bed just simple really. Service was ok but didn't need there help really. We had to walk up one flight of stairs- not a problem its not that hard. We could see the Hollywood sign from our room and there wasn't really much noise coming from outside. Shower though isn't the greatest but does the trick. Overall excellent value for the price but only for those who plan on just sleeping in their room and with a rental car. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Fair budget option, good for a night or two.”
Reviews.Author: completely_beat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night in December. We checked in around 11pm and the (young) man at the front desk was great- efficient, a bit friendly but not fake, and accommodating. My husband smokes once in a while and we were considering getting a smoking room but I didn't want to sleep in a stinky ashtray. The clerk offered to show us the room so we ran up the three flights of stairs (there were a few other customers in line behind us and no elevator), I smelled the room, it was fine, we ran back down and we got the room. The room definitely felt like a small efficiency studio where B actors once lived, which means it was pretty large for a hotel room. The bed was fine, tv good, mini-fridge convenient, the toiletries in the bathroom much appreciated and free parking in the back a nice bonus. We may have heard noises from the adjacent rooms but nothing major. We had a view of the automobile repair shop across the street but in the morning we noticed a small peek-a-boo view of the Hollywood sign. There's in room coffee, a vending machine in the "lobby" but no ice. If you are a tourist who likes walking (some bus lines nearby and a couple of eateries but more options are available if you walk 1/2 a mile in any direction), or have a car, this might be a good budget option for you. If you are delusional and unrealistic, hoping for a 4 star room, you'll be disappointed. My husband and I have family in Silverlake and we are still trying to find our "go to" hotel. I don't think that this will be it but we'll definitely consider returning. PS. Sorry my photos suck.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE NASTIEST PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN IN!!! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Pinup B
Reviews.Content: i wouldn't even give this hotel 1 star!!!!!! this hotel is the nastiest hotel i have ever been in.. i would rather sleep on the subway than in this hotel.. the room smelled so bad that i thought they had rotten meat in it.. we tried to open the windows to air it out and even went to the store to buy air freshener .. no help.. i tried to get past the smell but the shower pushed me over the edge it had a mold growing in it.. i have stayed in some interesting hotels in the past but this was awful.. we ended up leaving the hotel and paid for another one. words cannot say how gross this place was.. yuck! yuck! yuck! you know it is bad when the subway smells better!

Reviews.Title: “Price + location = Very good ! (W/ pics)”
Reviews.Author: Susann86
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 14 days. The room got cleaned every day. For the price i think it was very good. The staff was friendly. Big and comfortable bed. Flatscreen tv, many channels. We paid 75 USD to get from the airport to the hotel, by taxi. On the way back the guy in the front desk fixed us a taxi for 30 USD! They don't have a restaurant/bar at this hotel though, but you have Taco Bell, McDonalds and Burger King and several mini markeds around. The elevator weren't in use, but the walk didn't bother us. Free parking. Paramount Studios is 200 m down the street. We also had view to the Hollywood sign. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and big room but very run down”
Reviews.Author: Ecarylloh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during our honeymoon before catching a flight and couldn't wait to leave. The staff were lovely and really helpful, and we were delighted when they upgraded us to a suite. Unfortunately, the room wasn't great. Although it was clean and very large, it (and the whole hotel) is in dire need of a re-fit and total upgrade. The decor is from the 70s/80s and the room stank of something - not necessarily nasty but almost as if it had been washed down with bleach too often! Points for service and trying, but we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place but no 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Chan O
Reviews.Content: we loved the staff and the hotel was neat, very old. the neighbor hood was a little skeechy and the rooms are in need of repair more like a motel 6 quality room. but a great deal for the price. no elivator but the bed bugs were gone.

Reviews.Title: “Works on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: SoLaras
Reviews.Content: No bells and whistles here. Hotel is definitely historic. - No elevators - very old furniture - old bedding - very 50's feeling + wiFi free + comfortable bed + free parking + location ( with car ) + cable tv I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Da price cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: damookie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December. It's an historic building that reminded me of days of yore. The amenities are limited, vending machine downstairs, but what do you expect for such a bargain price. It's centrally located so most of the "touristy" attractions are within a short driving distance. Staff was extremely friendly. No elevators so travel light. Kinda reminded me of an upper scale "youth hostel." Parking is plentiful and free. The only downside would be that it's not in the best of neighborhoods so I don't recommend this hotel for families that are using public transportation. If you have a car, no problemo. Will definitely stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nancy_siesta_key
Reviews.Content: Here are the pros and cons: PROS: price, free parking, location as long as you have a car, friendly and helpful staff, refrigerator in the room, coffee pot in the room, flat screen TV, free WiFi though it was spotty CONS: No elevator (we were on the 3 floor but it was fine for us), rooms were worn looking, comfortor and towels were trreadbare, along with the carpeting, couldn't reach the hangers, no outlet in the bathroom but then again, there weren't any hair dryers (you could get one at the front desk though), no restaurants in walking distance for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and didn't have a bad experience...”
Reviews.Author: MNBaker706
Reviews.Content: ( JANUARY 2011) My husband and I stayed here last year when we took our trip to hollywood. Hotel was really nice it was decorated for christmas so cute. The guy who works at the front desk isn't that nice, but that's ok. I just needed to get a key from him anyways. The room was good size and it faced the hollywood sign. The bed's were old and not that comfy but it wasn't like we had back aches either from staying there. We didn't have bed bugs, thank goodness as I see some of the other reviewers had that problem. It does only have stairs, so ladies make sure you have a strong man or pack light! haha! We had a good experience and didn't have any problems and the price is great if you are wanting to spend money on a lot of other things.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug warning + an objective review and advice on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: P M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 12/29-12/31. This hotel has bed bugs, and they admitted they’ve had problems in the past but have always addressed them right away. We moved out of our first room (no bed bugs) due to the noise. The person at the front desk moved us to room 205, and we immediately checked for bed bugs under the sheets. We didn’t find any, but we did see that there was a plastic covering around the mattress--evidence that they’ve had a bed bug problem in the room before. After our first night in the new room we woke up with a ton of bites. Later that day we were watching a movie on the bedspread and I saw a bed bug crawling on one of us. It was a classic bed bug, gorged in blood. We squished it and immediately showed the person at the front desk. He apologized profusely and instantly refunded our money for the rest of our stay, and we got the heck out of there for another hotel. What I would have written had there been no bed bugs: Before you book your hotel here, you need to have the appropriate expectations of what you’re getting. What you will get is: cheap accomodations akin to a college dorm room or hostel; hairdryer only upon request; shabby bed spread but generally clean sheets that may have a few spots; stained desk chair seat; generally old decor and furnishings; stark white tile bathroom that’s a little grungy but still ‘clean’; no central heat--they have a plug-in heater in every room; nice flat screen TV; internet that can be spotty. If you go in with these expectations, and the fact that you’re only paying something like $65/night for Los Angeles, then you will be fine. I would recommend requesting a room facing the parking lot, since the windows are extremely thin and if you get a room facing the road you will hear loud traffic all night. During our stay there were 2 individuals manning the front desk; one was really snippy and sarcastic, the other was extremely kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, interesting building”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyFarFromHome
Reviews.Content: An interesting building with lots of interesting old photos on the walls. The room was larger than I expected. (Maybe I'm spending to much time in tiny rooms in Asia?) Two floors but no elevator that I noticed. Clean and well maintained for the age of the building. I have no complaints. It was basic, but had what I wanted at a price I found to be completely fair.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: laura n
Reviews.Content: I got ATTACKED by bed bugs at this hotel. When I told the front desk clerk he seemed surprised (though reading these other reviews this was obviously a lie). Before booking at this hotel call and make them prove to you that they have had an exterminator in. Otherwise, it's not worth saving the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Pune-Doctor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 325 on Dec 24, 2011... horrible stay - Was woken up at 2:15 AM by bedbugs. Called the front desk executive - when he looked carefully at bed we found more bedbugs. Immediately checked-out. Ruined my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Small Price, Big Compromises”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Leeper
Reviews.Content: -- no elevator (may or may not be temporary), only stairs, and double-height stories so it is a long hard trudge. ++ high definition TV ~27", -- cable gets only the free stations, no TCM -- no listing of TV stations .. furniture from the 1930s .. air conditioner in window -- room seems poorly maintained ++ refrigerator -- no microwave -- two devices, probably the radio and smoke alarm, each give periodic quiet alarms--probably to indicate low battery. Reported at desk repeatedly but nothing done. Eventually it was quite irritating. Never fixed. -- smoke alarm without battery is probably a safety hazard and possibly illegal -- Two paper cups by coffee maker, none for bathroom, had to buy paper cups from grocery -- One coffee packet, no sugar or creamer -- no easily accessible electrical outlets--had to unplug coffee maker -- electrical outlets all two prong (except for air conditioner) -- windows need better insulation ++ has wifi -- Download is very slow, sampled at 693 kbps, later at 371 kbps .. Glamour pictures of movie stars on hall walls .. space heater (only heat source) and ironing board (no iron) in closet -- tiny bathroom, like on cruise ship, but with tub .. provides soap and shampoo -- noisy street sounds ++ nice view of Hollywood hills -- windows very dirty -- no phone in room, gives an 800-number to call the front desk, if no cell phone you have to walk to the desk -- only four hangers in closet -- only one wastebasket for room, in bathroom -- returned second evening to find both room keys deactivated, had to climb down stairs to get fixed and back up, rest of week OK ++ within walking distance of Hollywood and Vine ++ lots of good ethnic restaurants in area, 1/2 mile from Koreatown, Oaxaca restaurant across street

Reviews.Title: “not for the finicky”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price, but the place is not for the finicky. Don't think of this as staying at a hotel: it's more like a very nice hostel or a dorm. You will hear your neighbors; the bed is adequate but old, and I didn't want to touch the bedspread. Good luck finding an outlet to recharge your phone. They were replacing the hall carpeting while I was there, so they may be putting money into upgrades. My room this time had an unpleasant smell: air freshener covering up urine, I thought. Light came in through the curtains, so no sleeping in. While the hotel is non-smoking, I smelled smoke from the parking lot where smokers hung out. It's a gritty part of Hollywood, but there's a great Oaxacan restaurant across the street. I would stay here again if price was the primary concern, but I think I might fork out next time for something less "historic."

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value”
Reviews.Author: gurlrca
Reviews.Content: We were a large group staying at the Hollywood Historic and all really enjoyed our stay. We had great sized, clean rooms with comfy bed. The staff here are fantastic. Really friendly, more than happy to help and offer advice on what to see and how to get there. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super great value - cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrzenned
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely cute and excellent value compared to what else is around. Sure it isn't new, and our room was pretty small, but considering the price we paid ($50 per night), the room was more than sufficient, very clean, comfortable bed and we were even supplied with toiletries which was a nice little surprise. Staff were SUPER helpful and friendly. Their elevator is out of action at the moment, but the staff had our bags carried up and down the stairs for us, and they ensured we were on the first floor and close to the staircase for my mother, so less walking. Staff also organised our day trip to Universal Studios, and gave us clear and easy instructions to get around to the sites. Bus is only a short walk away and takes you directly to Hollywood Boulevard. We would happily stay here again if we ever get to return to LA! The staff were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Do not!! If visiting city of LA this is not place to be.”
Reviews.Author: LondonCouple23
Reviews.Content: We checked in and checked out in the space of ten minutes.. This was where we was finishing our California holiday - yes it left us having to find somewhere to stay but there was no way we could stay here. We ended up in the Crowne Plaza at Bervely hills. Yes alot more money but so worth it. This is cheap for one reason... Rooms are unpleasant... No lift... No safe.... Worst possible area in LA. Spend your money wisely and stay in Beverly Hills when visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good price”
Reviews.Author: kilifist
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on our first trip to Los Angeles. Awesome service, they checked us in early (around 10am) to accommodate our early arrival into LA. The rooms were not the flashiest but were tidy and had the required amenities that a hotel room should have. Great location, not in the heart of Hollywood but close enough to get to Hollywood Blvd and Sunset Blvd. Would definitely stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandEdward
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite interesting , single glazing windows might be a problem for some people but not me as i am a heavy sleeper . The rooms are clean and good car parking facilities at the back . No food available but good value overall . Reception staff are sound.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pajaro2c
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights at the end of our 3 week holiday. The picture on the website makes it look like a nice hotel. One side of the hotel on the ground floor is being leased to a showroom so the ground floor looks nothing like the picture. The entrance looks nothing like the pictures as one side is closed off. There is no lift. It is blocked off by a cabinet so if you are on the 3rd floor you will have to carry your bags up. The corridor and stair carpets are filthy and very worn. There is no telephone in the room and no tourist information anywhere. The bathroom is very small. You sit on the toilet with your knees up against the bath! The sink is tiny and was shabby looking. The bath was stained. The bedroom furniture is very old and worn. Our bottom sheet had black stains on it. Yes it had been washed and ironed but was still stained. We had no maid service and no clean towels for our second day. When we told the guy on the small reception desk he shrugged his shoulders. We had one bin in the bathroom. Plugs were in very short supply. The one easily available had the TV and fridge plugged into it so if you wanted to use it one of them had to be taken out. It looked like the hotel was shutting down as furniture was being removed from some rooms. Our corridor when we arrived reaked of bleach. Our bedroom windows did not lock shut as the locking device was missing. Yes it did have plenty of parking space and the bedroom was fairly big but thats not all you should be worried about. The area around the hotel looked very drab, dirty and did not make you feel safe if you walked around. A very disappointing end to our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Steveninsydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great value. The room I got was huge (209) and was very clean. I got great service from the reception. They offered to carry my bags upstairs. I arrived early and was able to get to my room straight away. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel - Free Parking - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shey07
Reviews.Content: There are alot of negative reviews about this property, but you know what, for the price you pay I would say its a pretty good hotel. It is a bit dated, but the bathroom was clean, the sheets were clean and the bed was comfy. The best bit is, you get free parking, which is difficult in LA. The location is excellent. This is a great hotel if you are on a budget. The only downside was the fact there was no elevator, so if you want a room with a view of the Hollywood sign then be prepared to suffer for it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers decent service and the best value for money. Prices are lower than in a hostel. Beds are comfortable and the room has a fridge and a coffee machine. Washrooms are quite old, but clean. Hotel has a large parking lot and rooms are cleaned on a daily basis. The only two problems are the location (far from most atractions and public transportation in LA is inefficient) and the fact that there's no elevator in the hotel. All in all, the experience was satisfactory and I'd stay there again if traveling low-budget.

Reviews.Title: “We prepaid our stay but... they overbooked us!”
Reviews.Author: goodtraveller85
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1.00 in the night after a 24-hours flight from Europe, we were 3 couples and prepaid our stay of 3 nights there. Once arrived at the Reception, the guy told us that he had to overbook one of our rooms... altought we have totally prepaid our stay! The crazy thing is that he found us a Motel6 and... we had to pay again our stay there! Usually a hotel which overbooks Guests assist them in re-booking a room on their behalf in another hotel of the same category, and of course covers all charges of the overbooking... this did not happen to us! The couple overbooked went to this Motel6 and once arrived there... the motel asked them for a total prepayment of their stay. Absolutely crazy. The receptionist at Hollywood Historic Hotel was totally rude and unhelpful, as he felt "strong" as he knew we couldn't do anything at 1.00 in the night after 24 hours flight. He told us "That's it, pay for the other hotel or go away". He promised us that he would have recharged us the amount paid at Motel6, and we actually did not understand why instead he simply couldn't pay directly that motel! After 10 days we finally fortuntately found the refund. But we will never forget the way he treated us. Concerning the room: small and dirty. That's it. Our suggestion is: simply don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, free parking”
Reviews.Author: markmctaggart
Reviews.Content: The room was ok considering the price we paid. The room was clean and comfortable enough and there is lots of free parking available. Although reasonably central, you still need a car to get to anything worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: If you're after a luxury accommodation experience, you won't get it here. The TV reception was poor, the air-conditioning was barely functional and there was no elevator, so enjoy carrying your bags upstairs. Having said that, the price was great ($50 per night) for the location (5 minute walk to buses for Hollywood and Universal Studios) and parking is free. Recommended if you want to be closer to the Hollywood side of L.A. but don't have much to spend on accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cost benefits”
Reviews.Author: Ugioni
Reviews.Content: The room has a good size, the bed is huge. Wifi free. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Marloes_11
Reviews.Content: It was the first hotel we stayed in after arriving at LAX. The clerk was friendly, and the room was spacious. Not very close to the highlights of Hollywood, but nice there was free parking and the rates were good too. Not the best hotel we stayed in though.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel near central LA”
Reviews.Author: menorka
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Historic is a nice hotel, with good size rooms (as well as a walk in closet!) and own bathrooms, aswell as free Wi-Fi. Since me and my boyfriend were staying for 10 nights, we appreciated the cleaning and the Wi-Fi. The staff is friendly, there's menus in the lobby if you want to order food and there's a phone to call a cab. Just across from the hotel is a gas station, a mini mart, and a bus stop (number 10). Within walking distance, there's bus 207 and 757 (at Melrose/Western). Walking to Hollywood Boulevard and Walk of Fame takes 30 mins. We like to walk. Let me tell you - walking in LA is hard. If you have a card, you can get anywhere, sure. There's even parking in the back. But we chose a vacation without a car. It'd be nice to stay closer to a subway station, but we managed pretty good using the buses. + Real good price Close to buses Nice staff Clean Wi-Fi Near Mini Mart Awesome restaurant (Osteria La Buca) 30 seconds away Near Paramount Studios - Location is a bit off (unless you have a car) Far away from subway Not much to see in the area Dark streets to walk home at Stairs only, if you have trouble walking Would be nice to get towels changed if we leave them on the floor

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good price and near all LA activities”
Reviews.Author: LauraL81
Reviews.Content: Historic Hollywood Hotel is an old hotel, but clean, comfortable and with the essential you need for your stay. Our room was small, with tv, refrigerator, free wifi, a small bathroom, but all clean, comfortable and quite quiet. The only negative points were the lack of socket and the small sink. There's no hairdryer in the bathroom, but you can ask one to the receptionist. Hotel parking is free. In general the hotel has the advantage of having a really good price and of being in a strategic position of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers701
Reviews.Content: Easy access to public transportation to get to Walk of Fame downtown Hollywood. Museums easy to get to using public transportation. Just steps away from Paramount Studio. Excellent lot tour! Nice view of Hollywood sign on the Hollywood Hills. The hotel displayed memorabila from the 50s. Absolutely charming! Rates very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “The owner has no integrity.”
Reviews.Author: JacquieBlaze
Reviews.Content: The owner of the hotel doesn't have any integrity and double charged my card after I specifically asked the amount due. It took days to have it refunded and he then charged my card at a higher rate. He also threatened me with the non-availabilty of a room as a power play and abused his power based on the mood he was in. The staff are also very intimidated by him and I got nowhere trying to communicated with him via them. I wouldn't ever recommend the hotel to anyone. I was completely mistreated after spending 3 weeks there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and that is saying a lot since we couldn't even stay here”
Reviews.Author: Huffmyster
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights, two rooms...had a long day and tired children. Walked into a dirty looking hotel and a horrible smell. The clerk told us they overbooked and they had nothing for us. The clerk was nice but that didn't help us find another hotel. After calling the manager he said he would pay the difference to put us in another hotel....A MOTEL 8...so that tells you a lot when he told us to find a comparable hotel. I found a Choice hotel that was on Highland and were willing to take all of us. But with parking and at a higher rate. I never did see any compensation. If you like to risk it then this is the hotel for you....because the area was scary, the hotel was filthy, you may not have a room waiting and I still want know what the smell was???

Reviews.Title: “how on earth can this hotel get good reviews”
Reviews.Author: alpaul2005
Reviews.Content: you guys who give it good reviews have got to be kidding.the owners have to be writing these reviews themselves surely.ok i will start with the good point.room was spacious.now the bad points.i know its called historic but it is 2011 for goodness sake,thers no bar,no restaurant,no phone or any kind of information in room,and get this-no elevator.staff were not helpful at all,area does not look safe,location isnt the best for getting to universal,walk of fame,there are alot of hotels nearer for the same price.how on earth this hotel gets 3 stars is beyond me,its not worth 1 star.honestly dont book this,there will be better hostels out there.i have been to many places around the world,i have never written a review on any of them but felt i had to try and warn anyone from making the mistake of taking notice of the good reviews like we did,they cannot be genuine.i begrudingly give it a 1 rating only because your not allowed to give it a zero. this is the worst hotel ive ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrippin_2011
Reviews.Content: Starting with the clerk we were getting a bit afraid. He was just not friendly and helpfull. After checking in we had to carry our luggage upon the stairs cause there is no elevator. Rooms are OK, well decorated but the towels weren't really clean. The pillowsheets weren't clean either. So bring your own sheets or towels. Anyway, location is just ok. Just between Hollywood and downtown. Make sure you rent a car when you're visiting LA. You have a free parking space and the price of the hotel is really OK. You won't find this quality anywhere else for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: GermanHen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hollywood Historic Hotel during our first trip to California. I had originally only booked it to have a room the night after our arrival (most other places we stayed at during our holiday were not booked in advance). Our first room was large, clean and had a view of the Hollywood sign, which was great for us Europeans :-) The staff was super friendly and helpful (whether we needed to find a place for some nice breakfast at 7.30 am, were looking for some live music in the evening or needed to print out online tickets for the Universal Studios, whoever was on reception was friendly and helpful!) and we didn't find Melrose Ave. too noisy like some other travellers have said. We were so chuffed with the place that we booked another room for two nights before we were due to fly back home. This time the room was overlooking the car park (which was said to be the quieter option - couldn't really say, slept like a rock again) and had a Queen size bed but was just as clean and suitable as the first. OK, the place is not brand spanking new but this is part of its charm and is reflected in the excellent price! We would definately stay here again. Thanks again to all of you!

Reviews.Title: “Drug dealers & other criminals, stay here because no one will bother you”
Reviews.Author: JulieJ0122
Reviews.Content: The first desk clerk we encountered was unable to check us in, so we waited for another clerk who showed up about 10 minutes later from a break. The first guy was courteous, the second guy was pompous & rude. We seemed to be an annoyance to his workday by showing up. We were assigned to the third floor with an "oh, btw, there's no elevator." After gong up unending flights of steep steps, my asthma kicked in. I haven't had an asthma attack in five years but fifteen minutes in this building brought it all back, thank you. I was amazed at no elevator & noticed that the elevator doors in the lobby were blocked by a large cabinet. I asked the bellman about it & in broken English he said "we are trying to fix it." I mean, seriously, how does this place not get shut down for breaking ADA regulations?? There's no way any handicapped person could hoof it up the stairs here. The room itself was not impressive & it had a lingering, mildew odor that further complicated my breathing issues. The bathroom was small; only one face-sized mirror over the sink. The bed felt old & hard, & the cleanliness of the bedspread was questionable. I guess free parking is a very big deal for the L.A. area but also, you get what you pay for at this place. We later checked out & went to the Millenium Biltmore. Our local L.A. relative (who has lived in Brentwood for 30 years) told us this hotel is located in a horrible part of town. This is a great place to stay if you don't care about your personal safety, customer service, comfort, or your health. I'm amazed--TRULY--that this place received good ratings from anyone.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it! A Gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: anoif85
Reviews.Content: My friend, who lives in LA, scouted out this hotel for my first trip there with a friendand recommended it because it's located in a safe neighbourhood, at a very convenient location (5mins to the freeway, 10mins to Hollywood & Sunset Boulevard by car) and offers free parking which is amazing because that is partically non-existent in hotels anywhere in the world! While the hotel is definitely no Hilton, it is a standalone gem because of it's architecture and interior design. The hotel staff are really nice, friendly & understanding too which is a huge plus! Our return flight was a past midnight flight so it didn't make sense to check out at 12pm because we had the whole day to go. So we asked the front desk if we could extend and were told that if we wanted to extend till 6pm (the norm maximum), we had to pay an additional $20 which was very reasonable, so we did and they gave us the room till 7pm instead! Of course, there are some downsides too, as with all places. No elevator, small bathroom and thin walls but these are all honestly very bearable & after a day, you won't even think about it. I quite like the fact that there's no elevators - suits the hotel and it gives you a good daily workout! All in all, it's a great hotel to stay in LA for $50/night - I've stayed in a hostel in Korea for the same price because I wanted an ensuite room, it didn't have elevators either & i even had to pay to get my room made up each morning over there! Great location, great staff and across the road, there's a great little mexican cafe that serves the most amazing freshly made guacamole! 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “What do you want for$50 What do you want for $50.00?”
Reviews.Author: Saralpo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May. The furnishings are cheap, the bed is not good, but you get free wifi, and a decent TV. The rooms have no phones, so if you have a problem you can use your own or hoof it down to the lobby. The elevator is permanently out of order ( blocked off). But it's really cheap and seems relatively safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad But Could be Better”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel for a 10 day trip but had to leave because of very bad computer routing issues. First of all the pluses are a very nice old historic hotel with a somewhat friendly staff, free parking and decent room for the price. The bad though was the room had a very bad smell of smoke, I saw a few bedbugs ( I always carry a spray when I travel so ....) The fridge never worked properly. I can say that with better maintenance and a better wifi system this hotel could be ok. I moved to another hotel a few blocks north and my computer has no problems. My point was that something was wrong with their system. The clerk insisted it was my computer. I am at the other hotel writing this and never get cut off as I did at the Hollywood Historic Hotel. They need to fix this problem and take responsibility and be accountable for their problem. I also do not understand why they have an elevator shaft but have no elevator. It is not the worst hotel in fact it could be a gem. It is a beautiful building but could use better management. & invest some money into it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: TeddigrahamxD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the HHH for a total of three nights. When we first got there we had an unwelcome feeling checking in with the guy working at the front desk. He didnt seem like he cared much about helping us or getting us settled in, instead he decided to talk to his friends. When we finally got our room key the room turned out into a disapointment because the pictures looked so much cleaner and bigger. We had a queen size non smoking room. Theres a tiny mirror in the bathroom and the sink is waaay too small whereas everytime i went to wash my face water would splash everywhere!! The sheets on the bed also had boogers on it. Gross!! And the left side of the bed smelled like seman and bleach. Yeah i wish i was making this up. I couldnt sleep on the bed because it felt so dirty that my boyfriend had to request new sheets! After the first night with new sheets and having some sleep from driving all morning the stay became better. If your going to stay here make sure to bring a candle or air freshner for room and bathroom for the bathroom has NO window it smells BAD!! And make sure to bring your own blanket or throw overall the maids made us feel very safe they welcomed us and when we left one maid even offered to help us with our lugguge. Once we came to the front desk the guy didnt even say anything to us go figure. I mean i understand he WAS busy watching a movie and all.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and we were happy with our room - would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: naomi83
Reviews.Content: We arrived here fearing the worst after the mixed reviews and the low price ($50 + tax), but we were pleasantly surprised with our room. It had the basics – large bed with clean linen, clean bathroom, room to store our clothes and bags, a large flat screen tv with cable, a large fridge and a coffee maker with coffee that was replenished daily – the only thing it didn’t have was a phone and an alarm clock. The free wifi worked really well in our room (3rd floor). The free parking was another bonus as we hired a car to go to the beaches and drive on to Vegas. Our room was overlooking the car park so we didnt experience any street noise or noise from other rooms. We were also impressed with the staff who were really helpful with pointing out the sights and booking a tour for us, plus we had a maintenance issue when a bulb went in the bathroom and this was remedied within 5 minutes of reporting it – one guy on the front desk even let me call the UK on his mobile as he said the public phones would be expensive! The area is ok – not the best on Melrose which gets nicer as you walk towards Fairfax, but close to a few restaurants and there was a petrol station and some convenience stores opposite the hotel. We enjoy walking so were able to walk to Hollywood Boulevard (about 30mins) and also walked to Sunset Blvd and the Farmers Market on Fairfax but we were also able to get buses from near to the hotel (though we felt the bus system is very slow by other city standards - we waited 40 minutes for one bus!). Paramount Studio is also close by. There were a few homeless people around but it didn’t feel unsafe and there were more homeless people begging on Hollywood Blvd than around the hotel. There are obvious downsides ie: being in an older property, no elevator and no breakfast but this didn't bother us due to the price - I think you have to be realistic! I would definitely stay here again if I were to return to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 *s but can`t quite rate it that high”
Reviews.Author: tfberry
Reviews.Content: The positives are great free parking, great location, view of the Hollywood sign, flat screen TV with lots of stations, refrigerator, shampoo, conditioner, lotion supplied, nice shower, and gigantic closet. For the price of $50 + tax, can't beat the price at essentially Melrose and Wilton. The negatives were no ice machine and I wouldn't rate the bed at one of the best. You also might need to use the air conditioner to provide white noise to sleep as Melrose Avenue is obviously a busy main drag. Hollywood & Vine is about 2 miles away so I just walked up to Hollywood, and I also walked to the Hollywood Farmer's Market at Selma & Ivar on Sunday morning. The front desk has umteen monitors so the place seems very safe + the hotel is like 2 blocks from Paramount Studios if you are interested in going there. There is no breakfast of any kind AND remember there is no elevator so you must be willing to climb stairs as I did staying on the 3rd floor. They do have interesting movie photos on the hallway walls.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: TimesTraveller
Reviews.Content: I am very confused by reveiws calling this hotel 'great'. There are no stairs, the rooms are MINISCULE and over populated with unnecessary furniture (in ours we had a four poster bed, a full chest of drawers, massive flat screen TV, two side drawers, a writing desk, chair and fridge in a room that was less that 12m2), the noise from the street was ridiculous as the windows have a gap and the bathroom frankly scared me. I did like the view to an extent, the immediate view wasn't that captivating but we could see paramount studios and the Hollowood sign from our window which was nice on a clear day. It was close to bus stops and is about 30mins walk from the scenic part of Hollowod Blvd and therefore the Metro stations. Its not too far from a Trader Joe's and a few decent restaurants. It is well located for the price and I have to say we did have a great time here. Our biggest issue was the sizeof the room and how packed it was with furniture. So much so that at one point we actually considered moving some of it into the very spacious hallway! I wouldnt recommend the hotel personally, it claims to be ALOT nicer than it is and seems to have airs and graces in both design and atmosphere that it hasnt earned.

Reviews.Title: “Wake Up Touristas”
Reviews.Author: oromariposa
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Great! It is centrally located,in the heart of the city.The neighborhood is safe and readily accessible to public transportation. The decor of the Hotel is beautiful. There is an air of old Hollywood with the pictures of all of the great film stars decorating the walls. The rooms and linens are very clean. If you need an elevator or room service ...stay someplace else and pay dearly for those unnecessary services. I say unnecessary because the Hotel has only 4 stories and there are restaurants and markets at close proximity. This is a great place to stay......don't be fooled because of the very reasonable room rates.......thinking the accommodations are substandard...they aren't. Don't overlook this "Gem "....if you do ..you will be missing out.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: JoeCooper
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel, i can't imagine what motivates people to write positive review about it. It is within a certain budget, granted, but that's about the only saving grace. The hotel is located in a not-so-nice neighbourhood where the local billboards are in spanish. It is a solid walk to any kind of public transport or decent grocery store. A previous claim mentioned that it was centrall located - it isn't. It's about 40 minutes by foot from Hollywood and Highland (the downtown Hollywood area - Graumann's, Walk of Fame, etc) and the walk is not through the safest neighbourhoods. The room itself is reasonable - not bad for the price we paid - but there were a few concerns when the tv wasn't plugged in and the entire entertainment unit had to be dragged closer to the powerpoint. The enamel is peeling in the bath and the lights each operate by chains dangling from the ceiling - some of which were damaged. We had a room on the third floor, however the lift isn't operation and the stairways are snug, so we had a struggle getting our suitcases up. There was no offer of assistance from the desk clerk. The stay in the hotel (particularly in the morning) was perforated with conversations and furniture movement in the hallways by the staff. A smell of paint lingered as they redecorated. On our second day the maid forgot to even tend to the room. In the late afternoon/early evening someone came by to drop off new towels, with no mention of why the room was un-made. Ten minutes later another set of towels were offered, again no mention. When it was obvious nothing would be done and the facilities needing restocking we complained to the desk clerk. He was almost insistent that it was our fault for having the "do not disturb" sign up - even though we didn't have a "do not disturb" sign in the room and had been out all day. Overall we weren't impressed. The wireless internet is only ok and the cable tv is good - when it works (although this might be a complaint against the cable company, not the hotel). For what we paid it was average. In our next hotel (Anaheim) we paid less and got better. I wouldn't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: inseglet
Reviews.Content: Based on the pics I was expecting something much better. In a nutshell: it's a very old place that lacks maintenance, the bed was dusty - but then again, the entire place was..., there were bed bugs (I woke up with my right arm and back almost swollen! what a dreadful experience) and it was very noisy: corner room, traffic outside and a building structure that only amplified it (thin walls and windows. And that big HOLE on the wall for the AC certainly didn't help either). The only good point is, there was a large free parking space but that was about it.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right,easy parking”
Reviews.Author: martijn_dutch
Reviews.Content: Good location, free parking. Smells a bit old as well. Carpet in staircase is worn out. NO BAR OR BREAKFASTS. If you're on the streetside as I was take earplugs. Single sheeded non isolation glass does not hold any streetnoise. WiFi is free but weak in my room. Location is ok but remember you need a car anyway in LA (and I'm European!)

Reviews.Title: “The 3 C's...Clean, Charming and Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: zgirl8
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical but hopeful when I found this place. I mean, how good can a $50 a night room in Hollywood be? But after reading all the reviews, I decided to give it a chance and I'm glad I did. Here are my impressions, and responses to some of the negative comments I've read from others: Location- It's very centrally located. If you're a tourist, you're only a few minutes from lots of main attractions. To those who complained because they didn't have a rental car...are you crazy? It's LA for heaven's sake, you're GOING to need a car! I rented one for 5 days for $108, and that was at an expensive airport location. Use a little of the TONS of money you're saving by staying here and rent a car! As for neighborhood safety, I am a female traveling alone and I felt very safe. You just have to use common sense like in any big city. Restaurants- To those who said there's nowhere close to eat, I just don't get it. In addition to the Italian place already mentioned, there are 2 excellent Mexican restaurants within 2 blocks. And if you have a car, there are literally dozens of restaurants within a 3 minute drive. Be adventurous, people! Building- VERY cool, especially from the outside as you can see. All the old Hollywood pics are fun. The view of the Hollywood sign is great. As others have said, there is no elevator. I could care less, personally. I stayed on the top (3rd) floor and welcomed the run up the stairs after dinner! It's not luxurious, but still nice and not run-down feeling. Amenities- Free parking! If you've spent any time in LA you know this is HUGE! And free wi-fi! Mine worked perfectly in room 315, not sure why others had problems. There are fridges in the rooms, another great perk. No restaurant or room service. No ice machines, just snack and drink machine in lobby. Basic cable. Rooms- Somewhat sparse but quite comfortable, medium-sized room. The bedspreads and curtains were a little threadbare, as others have noted, and the sheets and towles were not the highest quality, but they were snowy white and spotlessly clean. I received clean towels and linens each day. I slept well on my bed. No outlet in the bathroom, but it was not a problem for me. I always had a place to plug in my laptop and phone charger, too. The only furniture was bed, nightstand, desk w/chair, and TV cabinet/dresser combo. Fine for just one but might need more seating for 2. Large closet with hangers. WIndow A/C, portable heater (I didn't need either). I was on the street side of building and loved it for the view of the hills, H'wood sign, and street action, but if traffic noise bothers you get one in back for sure. Bathroom had good water pressure and was very clean. Staff- I had limited interaction but they seemed very friendly and helpful. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for bargain shoppers, adventurers, and city-lovers. It's not for the lazy, disabled (lack of elevator), unimaginative or spoiled. I was amazed at the excellent value. I don't think I would have been any happier at most of the places that charge triple what it cost to stay here. I will DEFINITELY return, and send my friends here.

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: sha598
Reviews.Content: I was wary based on both other reviews and because I know there are several run down motels in the area, but this place was great for the price. Rooms are very basic, no phone but there was a flatscreen with cable, and there is a staircase you have to climb, but the hotel itself is beautiful. The location is great, especially if you enjoy a little walking, and extremely close to everything if you prefer to cab it without paying a fortune. wild oats cafe is nearby and is great for a bite to eat. Basically, if you are planning on spending most of your time out and about, this is ideal. If you prefer the small amenities pay the extra elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: derrtysaint
Reviews.Content: I must admit, i was skeptical of this hotel. I did my research and everything in the Hollywood, Sunset, Melrose area was way overpriced. Since we only sleep in the hotel, i booked the Hollywood Historic Hotel. From the time, we stepped foot in the hotel lobby, we were very impressed! The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to accomodate you. GREAT JOB to James, Vladimar, and Edward!!. Outstanding job fellas. We stayed 04-04-11 thru 04-07-11 (#309) and the only downfall to this hotel is no elevator. Buy hey, look at it this way, you have a daily exercise routine. Other than that, we both are gonna staty here. The free parking is good. We were literally less that 5 minutes from Sunset and Hollywood Blvd's. Again, GREAT JOB TO EDWARD, VLADIMAR, AND JAMES ( from my hometown )!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Ideal Hollywood Location”
Reviews.Author: AlexHarrison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollwood Historic Hotel for 4 nights as a stop over before my final trip back home to the UK. The look of the place is really something a bit different and caught my eye straight away, the 1930/40's theme worked really well and i loved the pictures of all the old movie stars and places along the walls! The room itself was perfect, nice king sized bed, clean, good sized bathroom and cable tv and for the price i thought it was amazing value! I understand why some people complain about the no elevator issue but for the price i dont see how they can complain, i myself had to carry to 2 big suitcases up to the 3rd floor on my own and it wasnt easy but i for everything else the hotel offered i overlooked it! The free wifi was a nice touch too, sadly for me my laptop had problems connecting to it but lookily the manager of the hotel allowed me to use his laptop whenever i needed to check up on emails and such like which i felt was a really nice touch! The location in Melrose is ideal if you have a car to travel about in, sadly i didnt but as i dont mind walking the 45 minute walk to hollywood boulevard was pleasent enough, Also Paramount pictures in literally 2 minutes walk from the hotel and my favourite place i found was Larchmont village was again only a 20 minute walk away! Overall i would definetly stay at this hotel again, if anything for the amazing value!

Reviews.Title: “can't beat it for value”
Reviews.Author: giromondo
Reviews.Content: Funky hotel with a lot of history and incredible room rates. The rooms were clean, and very basic. Great if you're looking for a place for sleeping vs. hanging out. The rooms on the Melrose Ave side of the hotel are a bit noisy. Free parking and free wi-fi were nice surprises. Location is very convenient to Hollywood, West Hollywood, Silver Lake, etc. Lots of great restaurants within a mile. I doubt there's a better value in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Price”
Reviews.Author: smkf
Reviews.Content: From the looks of the hotel it seems OK. Lots of history. I love old buildings and thought this might be interesting. When we got inside to check in the fellow behind the desk was not really friendly. Just gave us our key and away we went up the STAIRS. 3 story building but I was lucky my husband could carry the bags to the room on the first floor. There was a very old elevator from years ago that is not used now. Once in the room at first glance it looks OK. We had a king bed. It was fairly comfortable. The closet was only about 1 foot wide but was enough for hanging clothes. It could not hold the luggage. There was a fridge and portable heater if it got cold. The curtains and bedspread are old so we took the bedspread off the bed and put it in the drawer. The skirt around the bottom of the bed was ripped and needed to be thrown out. The towles in the bathroom were old and small. They did supply the regular shampoo and soap. The tub was the original and had been resurfaced. The water pressure in the shower was fine. Very small bathroom but it worked. There was no electrical outlet in it. Back into the main part of the room I think there was only 2 electrical outlets total. One had a power cord and had the fridge and other things plugged into it. We plugged our laptop into it but had to be careful not to trip over the cord. The table you are suppose to put the laptop on was on the other side of the room and the cord did not reach. Actually the table was so close to the bed you could not put a chair at the table anyway. Oh yeah, did I mention there was not a chair anyway. There is no phone in the room. The only place to sit was on the bed. We used the place just to sleep anyway. We would walk up Melrose to Western and go right to Hollywood in about 15 minutes. The area is very seedy but Very convenient. Since we found there were really no decent places to eat near the hotel we ate before returning to the hotel. It is not a place I would like to have a toddler crawling around on the carpets. Checkout was the same as checkin. No thank you given. I think if we paid an extra $20.00 a night something else might have been better

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: appro
Reviews.Content: I felt the need to review this hotel as I was terrified of staying here after reading the reviews on here. Yes this hotel seems to be in a non-tourist-like neighbourhood but it's dead easy to get to the main sights. The buses stop right outside and up on Western heading north there is a check cashing place you can buy your all day bus passes for $6. Trust me these come in dead handy as places are quite far to walk all the way and back (i.e hollywood boulevard). The hotel is clean, toiletries are provided, there is a heater in the room if you need it and air con for when it's warmer. We got free wi-fi in the room too and at a great speed. There's a tv with loads of channels, a fridge and a coffee machine. I was at the back on the car park side (room next to the stairs on the first floor) but it was very quiet at night and I got a great nights sleep. For $49 per room this is well worth the stay, it's a bargain and much better than you would expect. The Italian a few doors down by the way is amazing and cheap ($18 for a main) and it must be good coz Tony Bennett was sat behind us. Otherwise, there is not much in dining terms around. There is a columbian over the road and Maccys round the corner but the buses can get you anywhere you need to go for food.

Reviews.Title: “In a sketchy area”
Reviews.Author: markymark_88_11
Reviews.Content: I had accepted the fact that there was no elevator, and that the rooms were going to be simple. I'm a young guy, so getting up the stairs with heavy cases was no drama. The area is sketchy though, this place is on the outskirts of Hollywood... You have to catch a bus everywhere. And if you've never caught a bus in L.A. then you're in for some eye-opening sights. Transport sucks in L.A. so if you plan on doing something at night, and making it back to the hotel safely, choose a more expensive hotel closer to Hollywood. We got kept awake at night because of some drugged up loony going nuts in the gas station across the road. As people have said, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The toilet blocked, the room smelt funky, no lift, no staff to help, appalling service, ripped cushions, dirty bathroom, scary location at night, nothing around, far from hollywood blv..... Shall I continue? Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “$50 a nite plus free parking? In LA? What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: HollyJ858
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay here, and I don't think we will stay anywhere else. Is it the most luxurious place you can stay at? No, and if you think that at less than $60 a night including taxes that it will be, you have some issues. What you will get is a budget hotel room in a not so bad part of Hollywood that is close to everythning you want to go to. There is a fridge and a small market & a liquor store right down the block. The bathtubs are old, cast iron, and HUGE! The beds are not the most comfotable, but for a night or 2, not a problem. Parking is abundant & free. On a budget? Certainly the place for you. There is no gym, but walking up the stairs is a great alernative! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding, but price was right”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkAmberLady
Reviews.Content: So, reading the recent negative reviews..either I was lucky or more tolerant. clearly, the price which we all agree is great. other than that.. All the rooms are NOt equal but this is from my experience: pro's : bathtub: decent water pressure: CLean. good closet. refrigerator; coffee maker: decent curtains and bedspread, nice t.v. , wireless internet, location apparently although it wasn't for me.. My bed was good, comfotable sturdy king. : Big parking lot, free parking. airconditioning.... Interesting historic photos throughout hotel about old Hollywood Cons: stairs: I had 3... 50 lb suitcases.. although I was seen, no one offered to help, didn't know there was any thelp available to hire, not visible. .. I'm a senior citizen and didn't know from website there was no elevator:..thought I'd DIE ! No stores nearby except for a little tiny mart across the blvd. wireless did NOT work for me, although it always does everywhere . very big bummer:. lighting in room awful: sockets inadequate . No phone in room. Housekeeping skipped my friend's room and mine, different days so service is inconsistant. staff was courteous although distant. I stay in hotels 26 weeks a year.. in most, they are more cordial ..sometimes friendly. Here, ? no. Example overheard conversation: "Do you have a restaurant in this hotel" : answer " No". end of conversation. Not,............ " no, but there are restaurants that deliver..here are some menus's" : or , No, but there is a takeout 3 blocks away: or ... anything helpful at all. Would I stay here again? Yes for the price and if I had a car.

Reviews.Title: “POOR SERVICE..NO ELEVATOR!!!U GET WHAT U PAY FOR.”
Reviews.Author: ptdogg
Reviews.Content: For just me staying by myself, i can deal with it.. You will hear the cars going by when your trying to sleep. The surroundings of the hotel, do look kinda funky. There are hardly any plugs available to charge cell phone or laptop. The ones that are available are in the oddest of locations (closet?). No plugs in the bathroom. The water turns cold, then hot. You have 2 remotes to control the tv and the cable box. i would never bring my family to stay here, but since i was alone, i dealt with it. i guess the only good thing is that your close to hollywood blvd. and sunset, so u don't have to travel far. I won't stay in this place if i have to travel alone again.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sunshinechica32
Reviews.Content: I always use tripadvisor when ever i'm planing a vacation that a hotel will be needed. i read so many reviews about this hotel it was ridiculous. i was prepared that the hotel might be an absolute disaster because it is so inexpensive this place isn't as bad as i had expected but it is definitely not the best. i'm actually still currently sitting in the hotel as i type this. we stayed one night here and i believe that u definitely get what you pay for. its a very basic room and when u walk in you can definitely tell that it is an extremely old building. the room smelled old and musky so we opened the window and turned on the ceiling fan and the air conditioner. then we proceeded to try to get ready to go out for dinner but we needed to charge our cell phones.. we couldn't find any plugs... the outlits were behind the tv.. which u can't reach... behind the bed.... which u can't reach.. no outlits in the bathroom.. and only one outlit where the refrigerator is plugged in. this made it a little hard for 3 two people two charge phones and straighten there hair :) upon returning to our room after dinner we decided that we needed showers.. i stopped down at the front desk and asked for and extra towel.. i was told that someone would come up to our room with it... no one ever brought an extra towel. the only other things that bothered me was that, as i said the building is old, the windows are only one pane and we were on the street side (which had an awesome view of the hollywood sign) so we could hear every single car that drove down the street. it sounded like we had left the window open all night. but like i said be for you get what you pay for.. its was $50 a night and it was a bed to sleep in. if ur looking for something nice.. don't stay here.. if u need a basic accommodation this place is fine for one night... but probably no more.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here because the rooms are $49”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlilly8
Reviews.Content: Not great, location is terrible - approx. 30 minute walk to Hollywood Blvd and buses are very confusing in this area unless you know the system which we didn't so we cabbed it each time back & forth to the hotel which was a $15 trip each time. Felt unsafe the entire time we stayed here, not a good area... You hear traffic & sirens all night long & we were given a room at the back with a carpark view, would have asked for anther room had we been given a front facing room though. The rooms are very average & basic, perfect for a 1 or 2 night stay, they have attempted to make it look nice with the red, sort of elegant looking bedspreads & curtains but the carpet & walls still look like those you would find in a sleazy motel... There is a funky smell in rooms & hallways too. Staff seemed very bored with the exception of one - Edward I think? But they work very long shifts so this is understandable, perhaps management should look at shorter shifts to get better service from employees. Housekeeping skipped us one day so was pretty dissapointed about that. TV's are great but who goes on holidays to watch TV? This money would have been better spent elswhere, maybe a curtain for our bathroom window so that people outside could not see in whilst showering? Beds are large but beginning to sag in the centre so not really comfortable. No phone in room - made things very difficult! I would not stay here again even for the price, would find somewhere in a better location for the same price & endure a 'not quite as nice room'

Reviews.Title: “great value, average room”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again for its excellent value - who can beat $49/night? It is clean, felt safe, has free parking and wifi, though I could only get a signal near the door of my room. The drawbacks are it is an older, rundown building with worn carpets. The bed was lumpy and the showerhead disperses an unsatisfying spray. The curtains aren't black-out, so light comes through in the morning. There's street noise even on the quiet side of the building. Still, it's $49/night. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Diddydarbons
Reviews.Content: In general the staff were indifferent to us as customers although one member of staff was really helpful. For the price this is a great hotel, a short taxi ride though from anywhere of interest. Buses do stop outside the door though. Brilliant tv, comfy beds just needs a bit of a makeover

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Fyrflyer
Reviews.Content: At this price I was apprehensive about what the hotel would be like, but it was perfect. Not luxurious, but the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby is really cool; it is just as quaint as the pictures make it look. I would totally recommend this hotel. Just bring your own hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravelBug3
Reviews.Content: For $49 a night it's hard to go wrong. We really enjoyed staying at the Hollywood Historic Hotel. The room was basic but large with a big separate wardrobe which was great to put all of our bags out of the way, and as a bonus our room had a view of the Hollywood sign. The location suited us as we had hired a car (which I would reccommend) and it was one of the only hotels in our budget that offered free parking. Although the location is a bit too far to walk to most of the main attractions (Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame etc) it was not a problem for us as there were plenty of places to park around the main Hollywood area (about $10 or free if you have a booked tour). Unfortunately we experienced problems accessing the wi-fi, but other than that it is hard to complain about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra low budget”
Reviews.Author: fshore1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for three nights around the Labor Day weekend. Even though it has been recently renovated, it feels like an old apartment building converted to a hotel. Having that said, the room and the bathroom was very clean, and the bed was OK. Make sure your room is facing the parking lot, or it will be quite noisy. Another thing to note is there is no elevator. On the positive side, the price is amazing. You do get free parking, and you are minutes away from Hollywood Blvd and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “a budget hotel with a good location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: teamjs
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a while for a budget hotel within short driving distances to several touristy places in LA. We had a lot to see in do in 2 1/2 days, and were able to get around pretty quickly staying here. But it is definately a no frills hotel. With a price of $49/ night (for the rest of the year I was told) its worth it! Free parking, too. I saw security cameras behind the front desk which was nice. I looked at a ton of hotels before choosing this one, and most of the hotels charge at least $15 day to park. The people behind the front desk were ok, except for my friend and I wanted to split the bill and when we checked out they had screwed that up. No biggie, that didn't ruin our experience. One thing that I didn't like was there wasn't an outlet in the bathroom! Made it difficult for 2 girls to get ready at same time.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely recommend this hotel to friends traveling to LA”
Reviews.Author: pinacolada023
Reviews.Content: We were quite surprised when we saw the price of $49/night online. At first, we weren't sure if we should book it (cuz it's a bit too cheap to be true) and thought maybe there's some catch. However, after reading several reviews on the hotel, we found most reviews were good so we decided to book the hotel. The hotel turned out to be better than I expected. With $49/night, parking overnight is also included (free of charge). The hotel staff were helpful and friendly; the room was okay (clean but not fancy); the location was great (close to lots of tourist area). We'd definitely stay there again next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Clean, Confortable...”
Reviews.Author: Gardenia073
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in Hollywood , walking distance to Paramount Studios and few miles to Hollywood Blvd. Small Hotel with a old school Hollywood deco, classic, simple and CLEAN ! We stayed for 4 nights and we were treated really good specially by the Latino employees. I really recommend this Hotel but dont expect the fancy style of a Marriott, Hilton..This is a nice Hotel located in a centric area in Hollywood if you need only a place to crash at night. I would like to thank Gilbert who took care of my room and offered me all the help that I needed while in the HHH. This guy Gilbert deserves the Supervisor position and I hope HHH give him the opportunity to grow or they will lose a great asset within the company. The maid was also really nice...

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Fi123
Reviews.Content: It was so nice to arrive at this place, after a 12 hour over night flight. We arrived very early, about 4/5 hours before check in, which i had notified them about when I made a booking. The guy at the desk was very surprised when I was expecting to check in so early but in fairness to him he had a room for us within 20 minutes. He was really nice to chat to too while we waited. The room was gorgeous! Huge tv, fridge, lovely ensuite. Couldnt fault it in the slightest! Location was ok, we were only there for two nights and spent most of our time in Hollywood. We walked alot (45mins to the chinese theater), but if i was going back to LA Id look abit more into public transport as distances are deceiving when walking! Theres also number of little supermarkets around the place, which was perfect for picking up snacks and breakfast. Id definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “definitely a yes”
Reviews.Author: Peppermango
Reviews.Content: Excellent price. Good front deskfront staff, willing to help. Our room was awesome, matching curtain and bedcover, love the pictures on the Wall. Nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful - a great stay in Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: jaybradley82
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful is what you can expect from the Hollywood Historic Hotel. Based in Melrose Avenue there are several main bus routes which can take you to West Hollywood, Downtown and Venice Beach. The rooms in the hotel were what you pay for a king size bed, plazma cable tv, big closet, bathroom (which includes bath, sink & shower), empty mini fridge to fill at your leisure, air con, and a hot water kettle with complementary tea & coffee. There is no room service available as there is no kitchen/dining area within the hotel but they do offer a room service menu where you can order delivery service from some of the local food outlets. The rooms are made up daily and one thing I thought was very good was the at the back of the do not distrub sign there was a sign for the maid to come in & make up your room ASAP which meant your room was priority. The staff were not overly friendly nor ignorant when asked a question by myself or my girlfriend they were always happy to help, and not rude but at the same time they seldom said hello when you walked in after your day or night out which would suit some people perfectly. Overall I would definately stay in this hotel especially if I were driving as the only thing the location lacked was a good bus route directly into Hollywood and some proper restaurants within walking distance and the only thing the hotel lacked was a swimming pool & dining area and one of the main things there is NO lift in the hotel but the staff were happy to lug our suitcase up the 3 flights of stairs

Reviews.Title: “A superb low cost hotel with easy access to the sights of LA”
Reviews.Author: J0hnlav
Reviews.Content: We had a very happy stay at the HOLLYWOOD HISTORIC HOTEL. A newly renovated building set in a very accessable location for HOLLY WOOD, Universal Studios and the Farmers Market. The hotel is well services with public transport, the number 10 bus stops a few yards from the front door. The Metro is a short bus ride away. Bus fares for seniors are 25c, the Metro $1.50. Our large room was well equiped with the usual coffee making, fridge and wide screen TV &. A/C..Although they don't have a restaurant/coffee bar, there is a little supply shop a few yards away. Also there is a very good Italian restaurant nextdoor but one. The room was spotlessly clean with a very comfortable large double bed. The only thing on the down side is the lack of an elevator to the first and second floors. As all the rooms are on the first & second floors this would present a problem for anyone with a walking disability.We are both in our 70's and had no problem with the stairs. Edward, who runs the hotel is very helpful and obliging Try and get a room at the back of the building, I think the front room could be noisy from the traffic. . .

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: abysse
Reviews.Content: We didn't know a lot about that hotel before making our reservation but were really pleased. We loved the "historic" look of it and the room looked really nice clean and the King bed was confortable. We had free wifi but it wouldn't work well in our room. We asked a room that was not on the street side (too noisy) but on the parking side and with the AC on it was perfect. There is not elevator but that wasn't a problem for us. Can't beat the price of 49$. Try to visit the Paramount Studios since it's the next door!! (make you reservation in advance)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place I'd stay at again, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: w3e4
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Historic Hotel is a great place to stay at in L.A. when you're on a budget. From what I understand, this hotel was recently remodeled by new owners, and they did a great job of turning this old place into a truly historic hotel that I'd love to stay at again. Pros: Clean and nicely decorated with old movie star photographs down every hall. Wonderful service. Everyone at this hotel is helpful and courteous. Good room for the price. A little small, but it's more cozy than anything else. Nice TV and a fridge. Free parking and they have a guard outside at night to protect your car. Gas station right across the street (fairly cheap too). Cons: West Hollywood is a little sketchy place, but I felt very safe at the HHH and had no serious problems or concerns. It is an older hotel, so you probably won't want to stay hear if you don't like that sort of quaint charm. Walls are somewhat thin. Plumbing can be loud, especially from the rooms above you. Overall, a wonderful place to stay that I would go to again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: zeneidathalia
Reviews.Content: I had to stay a month in Los Angeles and this was my favorite place: good location, very nice new rooms and the best price. Since it's a new hotel version, they are still installing phones, internet and, I hope so, a elevator also. The place is beautiful, the rooms are new and clean, the tv is great, the parking is huge and the location is excellent, but the best thing is the stuff: Gilbert always maked sure to help us with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AZExplorer2010
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great value in a central location near Hollywood, LA proper, and the 101 that will connect you with wherever else you want to go. - Rooms have been freshly redone - Free parking with security at night - Great main street with cafes and restaurants a short drive away Cons: - Period bathroom: small, no room to set anything down in it, old sink and tub, no electrical outlets - Overall lack of electrical outlets! Power strip in corner has everything plugged into it - No WiFi. I'm so connected now I had to sweat that one. - Stairs only

Reviews.Title: “Keep trying!”
Reviews.Author: klpopp
Reviews.Content: This seems to be an effort by someone who's pockets aren't deep enough to do the job right. Although the price was right, $50 for one night, it was a close call on if it was worth it. The hotel rooms are on the second and above floors, & the elevator does not work & doesn't seem to be on the list of improvements. Pack light! The drapes are of a sort that are floor length and so if you pull them it covers the A/C unit... The electrical system is from the 1950s, must be part of the "Historic" part of the name, we couldn't have the TV on and make coffee. Nice website though. Terrible internet connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for LA-Hollywood area”
Reviews.Author: tdehaan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. They do not clean your rooms daily. They gave us new towels upon request no problem. The fridge did not work so they replaced it. No elevator, so be aware of stairs. You can't beat $49 a night but you are giving up a few things. Staff was pleasant. Plenty of parking for FREE where some hotels charge up to $20 a night. We would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Historic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5162 Melrose Ave., Los Angeles, CA 90038
